articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said it had thwarted a coordinated Ukrainian attack on Crimea early on Sunday, while drones also targeted Moscow, disrupting air traffic in the capital, and caused a fire at an oil depot in the southwest of the country.
articles.title: Ukraine drones strike Crimea, Moscow, oil depot, Russia says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane crash in Brazil's northern Amazon state on Saturday has left 14 dead, the state's governor said.
articles.title: Plane crash in Brazil's Amazon state leaves 14 dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The chief of the World Health Organization urged Beijing to offer more information on the origins of COVID-19 and is ready to send a second team to probe the matter, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.
articles.title: WHO chief pushes China for ‘full access’ to determine COVID’s origins, Financial Times reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iranian security forces cracked down on protests in Kurdish areas of the country on Saturday and briefly detained the father of Mahsa Amini, a year after the young woman's death in custody set off some of the worst political unrest in four decades.
articles.title: Iran's security forces crack down on protests a year after Mahsa Amini's death

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands rallied in Australia on Sunday to support recognising the country's Indigenous people in the constitution, a proposal that is struggling ahead of a referendum next month.
articles.title: Thousands in Australia rally for struggling Indigenous referendum

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in southern China have detained some staff at China Evergrande Group's wealth management unit, suggesting a new investigation that could add to the property giant's woes.
articles.title: China police detain some Evergrande wealth management staff

articles.author: Renee Maltezou, Karolina Tagaris
articles.description: Greece will push ahead with state reforms to boost economic growth and offer relief measures to those hit by natural disasters, without risking the country's fiscal progress, Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said on Saturday.
articles.title: Greek PM pledges state reforms, disaster relief within fiscal limits

articles.author: Greg Torode, Martin Pollard
articles.description: The disappearance of China's defence minister, the latest in a string of upheavals in the country's top ranks, is stoking uncertainty about President Xi Jinping's rule as an internal security clampdown trumps international engagement.
articles.title: Upheavals in Xi's world spread concern about China's diplomacy

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The United Auto Workers strike against the Detroit Three automakers is set to enter its third day Sunday with no immediate resolution on the horizon.
articles.title: Autoworkers strike against Detroit Three enters third day

articles.author: Philip Pullella
articles.description: Wartime Pope Pius XII knew details about the Nazi attempt to exterminate Jews in the Holocaust as early as 1942, according to a letter found in the Vatican archives that conflicts with the Holy See's official position at the time that the information it had was vague and unverified.
articles.title: Letter shows Pope Pius XII probably knew about Holocaust early on
